summary: A November 9, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, transmitting a production of discovery materials (EFTA00010133) and noting they are subject to a protective order. The letter indicates the materials are largely duplicative of prior productions.

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces a set of discovery materials (EFTA00010133) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel, governed by a protective order.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

locations: The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is a formal discovery production letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, dated November 9, 2021.
The produced materials (EFTA00010133) are designated as subject to a protective order from July 31, 2020, specifically paragraphs 7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17.
The letter notes that the Department of Justice directed the office to cease using the marking 'confidential' on such materials to avoid confusion with classified document markings.
The government states its discovery obligations are ongoing and that the materials appear largely duplicative of prior productions.
The document references the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (MN).
